001package com.telos.loops.contacts;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference;
004import com.telos.loops.internal.CoreSender;
005import com.telos.loops.internal.mappers.ContactsMapper;
006import com.telos.loops.model.RequestOptions;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.Objects;
009import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
010import java.util.stream.Collectors;
011
012/**
013 * Client for managing contacts in Loops.
014 *
015 * <p>This client provides full CRUD operations for contacts in your audience, including creating,
016 * updating, finding, and deleting contacts. Contacts can be identified by email address or user ID.
017 *
018 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
019 *
020 * <pre>{@code
021 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
022 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
023 *         .build();
024 *
025 * // Create a contact
026 * ContactCreateRequest createRequest = new ContactCreateRequest(
027 *     "user@example.com",
028 *     null,  // userId (optional)
029 *     "John Doe",  // firstName
030 *     "Doe",  // lastName
031 *     null,  // source
032 *     true,  // subscribed
033 *     null   // customProperties
034 * );
035 * ContactResponse response = client.contacts().create(createRequest);
036 *
037 * // Update a contact
038 * ContactUpdateRequest updateRequest = new ContactUpdateRequest(
039 *     "user@example.com",
040 *     null,  // userId
041 *     null,  // firstName
042 *     null,  // lastName
043 *     "Newsletter",  // mailingLists (comma-separated)
044 *     null,  // subscribed
045 *     null   // customProperties
046 * );
047 * client.contacts().update(updateRequest);
048 *
049 * // Find contacts
050 * ContactFindRequest findRequest = new ContactFindRequest("user@example.com", null);
051 * List<Contact> contacts = client.contacts().find(findRequest);
052 *
053 * // Delete a contact
054 * ContactDeleteRequest deleteRequest = new ContactDeleteRequest("user@example.com", null);
055 * client.contacts().delete(deleteRequest);
056 *
057 * // Async example
058 * CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> future =
059 *     client.contacts().createAsync(createRequest);
060 * }</pre>
061 *
062 * <p>All methods are available in both synchronous and asynchronous (CompletableFuture) variants.
063 *
064 * @see com.telos.loops.LoopsClient
065 */
066public class ContactsClient {
067  private static final String CREATE_PATH = "/contacts/create";
068  private static final String UPDATE_PATH = "/contacts/update";
069  private static final String FIND_PATH = "/contacts/find";
070  private static final String DELETE_PATH = "/contacts/delete";
071
072  private final CoreSender sender;
073
074  public ContactsClient(CoreSender sender) {
075    this.sender = Objects.requireNonNull(sender);
076  }
077
078  // ============================================================
079  // Create Operations
080  // ============================================================
081
082  /**
083   * Creates a new contact in Loops.
084   *
085   * <p>This method uses default request options.
086   *
087   * @param request the request object containing contact details
088   * @return the response containing the created contact's status
089   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
090   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
091   * @see #createAsync(ContactCreateRequest) for the asynchronous variant
092   */
093  public ContactResponse create(ContactCreateRequest request) {
094    return create(request, RequestOptions.none());
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Creates a new contact in Loops with custom request options.
099   *
100   * @param request the request object containing contact details
101   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
102   * @return the response containing the created contact's status
103   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
104   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
105   * @see #createAsync(ContactCreateRequest, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
106   */
107  public ContactResponse create(ContactCreateRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
108    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
109    var generatedResponse =
110        sender.postJson(
111            CREATE_PATH,
112            generatedRequest,
113            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactSuccessResponse.class,
114            options);
115    return ContactsMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Asynchronously creates a new contact in Loops.
120   *
121   * <p>This method uses default request options.
122   *
123   * @param request the request object containing contact details
124   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the created contact's status
125   * @see #create(ContactCreateRequest) for the synchronous variant
126   */
127  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> createAsync(ContactCreateRequest request) {
128    return createAsync(request, RequestOptions.none());
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Asynchronously creates a new contact in Loops with custom request options.
133   *
134   * @param request the request object containing contact details
135   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
136   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the created contact's status
137   * @see #create(ContactCreateRequest, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
138   */
139  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> createAsync(
140      ContactCreateRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
141    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
142    return sender
143        .postJsonAsync(
144            CREATE_PATH,
145            generatedRequest,
146            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactSuccessResponse.class,
147            options)
148        .thenApply(ContactsMapper::fromGenerated);
149  }
150
151  // ============================================================
152  // Update Operations
153  // ============================================================
154
155  /**
156   * Updates an existing contact in Loops.
157   *
158   * <p>This method uses default request options.
159   *
160   * @param request the request object containing updated contact details
161   * @return the response containing the updated contact's status
162   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
163   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
164   * @see #updateAsync(ContactUpdateRequest) for the asynchronous variant
165   */
166  public ContactResponse update(ContactUpdateRequest request) {
167    return update(request, RequestOptions.none());
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Updates an existing contact in Loops with custom request options.
172   *
173   * @param request the request object containing updated contact details
174   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
175   * @return the response containing the updated contact's status
176   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
177   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
178   * @see #updateAsync(ContactUpdateRequest, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
179   */
180  public ContactResponse update(ContactUpdateRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
181    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
182    var generatedResponse =
183        sender.putJson(
184            UPDATE_PATH,
185            generatedRequest,
186            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactSuccessResponse.class,
187            options);
188    return ContactsMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Asynchronously updates an existing contact in Loops.
193   *
194   * <p>This method uses default request options.
195   *
196   * @param request the request object containing updated contact details
197   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the updated contact's status
198   * @see #update(ContactUpdateRequest) for the synchronous variant
199   */
200  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> updateAsync(ContactUpdateRequest request) {
201    return updateAsync(request, RequestOptions.none());
202  }
203
204  /**
205   * Asynchronously updates an existing contact in Loops with custom request options.
206   *
207   * @param request the request object containing updated contact details
208   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
209   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the updated contact's status
210   * @see #update(ContactUpdateRequest, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
211   */
212  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> updateAsync(
213      ContactUpdateRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
214    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
215    return sender
216        .putJsonAsync(
217            UPDATE_PATH,
218            generatedRequest,
219            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactSuccessResponse.class,
220            options)
221        .thenApply(ContactsMapper::fromGenerated);
222  }
223
224  // ============================================================
225  // Find Operations
226  // ============================================================
227
228  /**
229   * Finds contacts in Loops by email address or user ID.
230   *
231   * <p>This method uses default request options.
232   *
233   * @param request the request object containing search criteria (email or userId)
234   * @return a list of matching contacts
235   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
236   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
237   * @see #findAsync(ContactFindRequest) for the asynchronous variant
238   */
239  public List<Contact> find(ContactFindRequest request) {
240    return find(request, RequestOptions.none());
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Finds contacts in Loops by email address or user ID with custom request options.
245   *
246   * @param request the request object containing search criteria (email or userId)
247   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
248   * @return a list of matching contacts
249   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
250   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
251   * @see #findAsync(ContactFindRequest, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
252   */
253  public List<Contact> find(ContactFindRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
254    var queryParams = ContactsMapper.toQueryParams(request);
255    var generatedContacts =
256        sender.getList(
257            FIND_PATH,
258            queryParams,
259            new TypeReference<List<com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.Contact>>() {},
260            options);
261    return generatedContacts.stream()
262        .map(ContactsMapper::fromGenerated)
263        .collect(Collectors.toList());
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Asynchronously finds contacts in Loops by email address or user ID.
268   *
269   * <p>This method uses default request options.
270   *
271   * @param request the request object containing search criteria (email or userId)
272   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of matching contacts
273   * @see #find(ContactFindRequest) for the synchronous variant
274   */
275  public CompletableFuture<List<Contact>> findAsync(ContactFindRequest request) {
276    return findAsync(request, RequestOptions.none());
277  }
278
279  /**
280   * Asynchronously finds contacts in Loops by email address or user ID with custom request options.
281   *
282   * @param request the request object containing search criteria (email or userId)
283   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
284   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of matching contacts
285   * @see #find(ContactFindRequest, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
286   */
287  public CompletableFuture<List<Contact>> findAsync(
288      ContactFindRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
289    var queryParams = ContactsMapper.toQueryParams(request);
290    return sender
291        .getListAsync(
292            FIND_PATH,
293            queryParams,
294            new TypeReference<List<com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.Contact>>() {},
295            options)
296        .thenApply(
297            generatedContacts ->
298                generatedContacts.stream()
299                    .map(ContactsMapper::fromGenerated)
300                    .collect(Collectors.toList()));
301  }
302
303  // ============================================================
304  // Delete Operations
305  // ============================================================
306
307  /**
308   * Deletes a contact from Loops by email address or user ID.
309   *
310   * <p>This method uses default request options.
311   *
312   * @param request the request object containing the contact identifier (email or userId)
313   * @return the response containing the deletion status
314   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
315   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
316   * @see #deleteAsync(ContactDeleteRequest) for the asynchronous variant
317   */
318  public ContactResponse delete(ContactDeleteRequest request) {
319    return delete(request, RequestOptions.none());
320  }
321
322  /**
323   * Deletes a contact from Loops by email address or user ID with custom request options.
324   *
325   * @param request the request object containing the contact identifier (email or userId)
326   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
327   * @return the response containing the deletion status
328   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
329   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
330   * @see #deleteAsync(ContactDeleteRequest, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
331   */
332  public ContactResponse delete(ContactDeleteRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
333    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
334    var generatedResponse =
335        sender.deleteJson(
336            DELETE_PATH,
337            generatedRequest,
338            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactDeleteResponse.class,
339            options);
340    return ContactsMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
341  }
342
343  /**
344   * Asynchronously deletes a contact from Loops by email address or user ID.
345   *
346   * <p>This method uses default request options.
347   *
348   * @param request the request object containing the contact identifier (email or userId)
349   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the deletion status
350   * @see #delete(ContactDeleteRequest) for the synchronous variant
351   */
352  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> deleteAsync(ContactDeleteRequest request) {
353    return deleteAsync(request, RequestOptions.none());
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * Asynchronously deletes a contact from Loops by email address or user ID with custom request
358   * options.
359   *
360   * @param request the request object containing the contact identifier (email or userId)
361   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
362   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the deletion status
363   * @see #delete(ContactDeleteRequest, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
364   */
365  public CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> deleteAsync(
366      ContactDeleteRequest request, RequestOptions options) {
367    var generatedRequest = ContactsMapper.toGenerated(request);
368    return sender
369        .deleteJsonAsync(
370            DELETE_PATH,
371            generatedRequest,
372            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ContactDeleteResponse.class,
373            options)
374        .thenApply(ContactsMapper::fromGenerated);
375  }
376}
